topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
With all this talk about immortality, what would you guys do if you were immortal?
And don't bring 'The Man From Earth' into this.
Every time there's a talk about immortality, someone brings in that movie.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5333c9336368721a49df0100#post_5333c9336368721a49df0100

I would be a legend. Shadow, the Omega Hedgehog.
topics.author: 5239db6da4c72d22d9000358

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5333c9336368721a49df0100#post_5333c9336368721a49df0100
If truly 100% immortal do the same thing I always do.  The only thing that would change is that I would over time try to learn everything.  The reason being is that if we're talking surviving the heat death of the universe you'd have a billion or so years to learn everything; then you would have a googol years until all energy dissipated and then another big bang happened due to recreating the same situation that lead to our universe.

Then wait until the new universe bangs then wait until the galaxies, stars, planets form and life evolve then do it all over just continue the same thing enjoying life.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body: im thinking of going to australia, any tips to not die?
topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@igotnopicks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5334ea1e63687268ef2f0000#post_5334ea1e63687268ef2f0000
Texas is a dry heat as well.

The one thing I hate is actually a sunny summerday.  Nothing is worse in my opinion than a cloudless summer day.
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5334ebf46368723bb0090000#post_5334ebf46368723bb0090000
Watch out for dropbears or your face is going to get mauled and turned to paste.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5334ebf46368723bb0090000#post_5334ebf46368723bb0090000
Do not touch anything natural, not even kittens. Its all poisonous.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@igotnopicks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5334ea1e63687268ef2f0000#post_5334ea1e63687268ef2f0000
I thrive in hot weather, heat warnings to me are like a blizzard warning for a skier. In the summer, I like to just sit in my car after it been sitting out in the sun for a few hours, it's like a sauna with wheels. Good thing it's done offgassing any glues and chemicals.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5334ec0c63687238e8090000#post_5334ec0c63687238e8090000
Actually it's not as dry.

90 degree weather is not really hot(Arizona gets to 100 and it keeps getting harsh) But overall Texas is fricken Humid(it's not dry if it feels like a sweatbag machine)

Actually it's not as dry.

90 degree weather is not really hot(Arizona gets to 100 and it keeps getting harsh) But overall Texas is fricken Humid(it's not dry if it feels like a sweatbag machine)[/bq]
Texas is a 105 and stays at a 105 for months without cooling during night.  The place I was living at was so dry the lake almost dried up.
